availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Chambers (Kentucky Congressman, judge, and soldier)

body.p: Kentucky Congressman, judge, and soldier. Second governor of Iowa Territory. New Jersey native. Married to Hannah Lee Taylor. Father of Margaret Taylor Chambers, Joseph Sprigg Chambers, Hannah Lee Chambers, James Chambers, Matilda Chambers, Francis Taylor Chambers, Jane Chambers, Mary Chambers, Laura Chambers, John Chambers, James Chambers, Henry Chambers, and Lucretia Chambers. Kentucky state congressman from 1812 to 1815. Served as Major and aid to Gen. William Henry Harrison during the War of 1812. Judge of the state Court of Appeals from 1825 to 1827. Replaced Thomas Metcalfe in the United States House of Representatives in December 1828 and served until 1829. Returned to the U.S. House in 1834 and served until 1839. Appointed as second governor of Iowa Territory in 1841 and served until 1845.

ab.bibl:
Perrin, William Henry, ed., History of Bourbon, Scott, Harrison and Nicholas Counties, Kentucky (Chicago, IL: O. L. Baskin, 1882), p. 458.
Find A Grave, "John Chambers (1790-1852)," Memorial #30039599, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30039599 (accessed May 5, 2020).
